description: KILO - a TRL 9 software - will be deployed and connected to the NATO CSD. Data will be injected and pulled from the CSD to experiment with the software's ability to standardize (NATO STANAG 4609) non-compliant streams and files to facilitate C2I Joint/Coalition interoperability. Participating systems should be TRL6+.

name: DCS Enabled Data Lake
description: Automate publishing and retrieval of NCDF SRM BSO Information Types (e.g., FFI Tracks and FMV File References) and others, to the Coalition Data Lake in (near) real-time using RSQL API. Layer with DCS services to bind all mandatory 5636 metadata and 4774 releasability labels to each entry to the data lake.

name: Interoperability with interactive simulation systems
description:
Participating Systems supporting Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) protocol, exchanging Protocol Data Units (PDUs), to create a simulated network.

The method "DIS over NIRIS" is used to send tracks to NATO ITC which translates them to TDL and vice versa.

Systems are able to contribute with synthetic data to an exercise network.

name: AEDP-17 Legacy (CORBA) synchronization
description: Testing of new AEDP-17 systems under development that are not ready for OBJ-013 AV&V testing yet. This Objective covers testing for AEDP-17-systems, both servers and clients. Specific tests for clients are not included in the FMN test cases, and will have to be developed specifically.

name: Interoperability between NATO & National systems via a Combat Cloud including a Data Fabric
description:
The purpose of this objective is to test the ability of a federated data fabric to act as a data-centric interoperability service to enable users and services to exchange, access and process data rapidly and securely from both a variety of NATO and National (near) real time and reference information sources.
At a minimum this objective will deploy two data fabric nodes (one denoted NATO and one denoted UK) and federate between them. The NATO node will connect to a NATO NIRIS server to ingest track data. This data will be federated seamlessly to the UK Node. Similarly, the UK node will ingest simulated track data and make it available to any NATO user/service via a simple REST-based data-centric. The NEXUS API will be published prior to the CWIX event to allow other experimenters to access data from the Weaver.nexus Data Fabric.
The System is a mature solution at TRL7 shortly to go live with the RAF and therefore the objective remains to demonstrate a national to NATO interoperability without direct connection of applications to data providers.

name: eXpl, eXpe – Cyber C2 information exchange between FMN MNPs cyber C2 and other domains C2 (Cyber)
description: Cyber Prioritized Asset List (CPAL) defined within a MNP is identified as COI services to other nation participants. Objective is to understand how a cyber incident on one COI service hosted within a MNP network may impact the mission assurance from another domain different from the cyber domain. When an incident occurs, MNP must execute mitigations actions on impacted COI service but it needs first to check those mitigations will not impact the mission and needs to synchronize with Joint level, through the joint cyber coordination team, which mitigations can be executed without impacting another domain planning tasks. Also the cyber picture including the service status and risks on using the impacted CPAL must be disseminated to inform the other domains of the situation to make them take the right decisions about using the impacted service. The cyber picture is updated regularly to inform about the CPAL status and update their decisions on using the service. Also after analysis of the incident, information of interests including discovered threat must be sent to other MNP Cyber C2.

name: SP6 Informal Messaging
description: Testing the SP6 SI on Informal Messaging, taking the Core Service Syndicate into consideration

name: FMN SP-7 Explore NCDF Service Concepts
description:
The NCDF is intended for all involved in the sharing of data between COIs through NATO and FMN information systems. This includes NATO, NATO nations, and partners as well as implementation authorities and system implementers, standardization bodies, operational decision makers, data managers and the NATO resource community.
The Objective Focuses on the Exploration of NCDF Service Concepts that are planned to be part of the FMN SP7.
Specifically, this family of OBJs are designed to explore the advanced federation of NCDF data nodes and Open search API functionality. An example of the Advanced Federation could be a data exchange between CC-025 and CC-228 or CC-002, when all of them are capable to transform the native data to the NCDF and eventually exchange NCDF data among themselves.

name: FMN SP-7 Exploration of NCDF Information Services node(s) advance  federation
description:
Data Lake Federation is a data architecture concept that leverages multiple data lakes and unifies them into a single, abstracted, and easily accessible data layer. 
Data Lake Federation empowers organizations to seamlessly integrate data from various sources, fostering quicker insights

name: FMN SP-7 Exploration use of Open Search API functionality of the Information Services
description: OpenSearch API is a set of technologies that allow publishing of search results in a standard and accessible format

name: Examine the national web-based interface to Readiness Reporting Tool (RRT)
description: The purpose of this objective is to examine the interoperability between national web-based pages and the NATO Information Page (NIP) where the Readiness Reporting Tool (RRT) resides.

name: FMN SP-6 eXperimentation with NCDF Security Posture
description:
Any interaction with a NDSA (NCDF Data Sharing API) component MUST be protected with the use of security tokens in addition to the use of a secured transport protocol. The NCDF Security Architecture document profiles existing FMN SP specifications and provides the NCDF stakeholders with the information to obtain compliant security tokens and convey them when accessing a secured NCDF interface. Any system implementing the NCDF Data Sharing API MUST implement and use the security services defined herein for the interfaces they make use of.
The standards and procedures here described support and enable the enforcement of authorization controls though those are not described herein. 
In support of Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC) the approach described in this document permits the exchange of user and service attributes. Such attributes are conveyed between systems and across domains within the security tokens.
The security services of this specification rely on additional external services. Those prerequisite services are not part of the NCDF architecture and are not profiled in this document, their implementation shall align with the relevant FMN specifications.

name: FMN SP-6 eXperimentation with NCDF security labelling and binding
description:
FMN SP-6 eXamination and eXercise of NCDF security labelling and binding. Exchanged information are correct labelled in line with the 5636/4774 and 4778


ADATP-5636 NATO Core Metadata Specification (NCMS) applies to all NATO information and to any data object handled or processed by NATO's communications and information systems. NCMS describes data object and supports its consistent and appropriate handling.
STANAG 4774 outlines the metadata syntax required for a confidentiality label to better facilitate and protect sensitive information sharing.
STANAG 4778 defines how a confidentiality label is bound to the data throughout its lifecycle and between the sharing parties.

name: FMN SP-6 eXperimentation with NCDF attribute based access control (PEP).
description: Using a NCDF enabled PEP we are able to enforce NCDF endpoint access security based on Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC). Protect the access to the NCDF producers' endpoints in line with the FMN Security SI

name: FMN SP-6 eXperimentation with Enable user Single Sign On (SSO) and ABAC in the context of NCDF.
description:
Any interaction with a NDSA (NCDF Data Sharing API) component MUST be protected with the use of security tokens in addition to the use of a secured transport protocol. two aspects are addressed via this objective:
- Single sign-on (SSO) is an authentication scheme that allows a user to log in with a single SSO ID to any of several related, yet independent, software systems. True single sign-on allows the user to log in once and access services without re-entering authentication factors.
- Attribute based access control (ABAC) is a security approach that determines resource access based on specific attributes associated with individual users, systems, or the environment.

name: FMN SP-6 Explore and Experiment with NCDF Functionalities
description:
Data sharing and integration across the Alliance and coalition environments is multi-faceted. The aspects within scope of the NCDF are standardisation and coherency in shared data requirements as well as interoperability and understanding of data being shared across the Alliance and Federated Mission Networking.

The objective is to Explore and Experiment with the NCDF Functionalities (captured in FMN SP-6) that developers can use to build interoperable services.
This OBJ is a parent OBJ for the following FMN SPR6 OBJs.

name: The NCDF Data Sharing API shall support receiving NCDF BSO data
description: Experiment the functionalities of NCDFDL_FUN_023.1 The NCDF Data Sharing API shall be able to receive all data (structured) in NCDF SRM format.

name: DCS eXploration of Labelling and Binding of data streams
description:
Labelling and Binding of data streams (Video:STANAG 4559/AEDP-18).
Propose a draft of binding data profile for video stream. 
Share samples of video data frame labelled.

name: AEDP-18 non-AV&V testing
description:
CSD Streaming test, FMV, GMTI & Link-16 metadata and UDP streams published and transferred between servers. 
This test is for any AEDP-18 system thatn needs to validate functionality.

name: The NCDF Data Sharing API shall support receiving NCDF BSO data CRUD instructions
description:
CRUD: CREATE, READ, UPDATE and DELETE (TIN-454).
Experiment the functions of NCDFDL_FUN_026. The NCDF Data Sharing API shall provide functionality to allow Data Providers to add/update/delete BSOs. An NCDF BSO must have a NCDF UUID, allowing for updates of existing BSOs rather than duplicates. This means that the CoI defined transformation must contain the algorithm for generating the NCDF UUID from the CoI specific BSO data.

name: The NCDF Data Lake accepts only NCDF compliant data.
description: Experiment the functions of NCDFDL_FUN_027 The NCDF Data Lake shall only accept data from Data Providers which is provided in NCDF compliant form. Even if unstructured, it must be 'wrapped' in or referenced by an SRM object. This is SP-6 (Experimentation) objective for NCDF family of CCs.

name: The NCDF Data Sharing API shall support the search & retrieval of NCDF BSO data
description:
(TIN-453)
The NCDF Data Sharing API shall support search & retrieval of NCDF BSO data by NCDF UUID and RSQL criteria.

name: NCDF SRM's utility for storing CoI data
description: Experiment the utility of the NCDF SRM with respect to the CoI specific data to be stored in the NCDF Information Services such as Lake Diver and IntCore. Maturity of participants expected - from experimental to operational.

name: NCDF ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Support Experiment
description:
Stages of this experimentation OBJ:
# Extract CoI-specific data from the data source
# Transform CoI-specific data into the NCDF with one of the transformation services (TIN-314 Transform Native to NCDF using NCDF Data Lake API)
# Load the data into an output container.

name: FMN SP-6 Transform Native to NCDF using NCDF API
description:
This objective is the Parent objectives for all of the Technology Interactions (TIN) - related OBJs, part of the FMN SP6  related to the Transform Native to NCDF using NCDF Data Lake API.
No CCs are expected to subscribe to this OBJ.

name: Transform Maritime MTF to NCDF
description:
TIN-311 Transform Maritime MTF to NCDF.
Maritime specific messages (e.g. OTH-G) will be transformed into the NCDF format and shared with the other C2 systems later on. 
Expected participation of fully mature CCs.

name: Transform FFT Data to NCDF
description:
TIN-XXX (number will be determined by DM CaT) Transform FFT Data to NCDF.
FFT data like Link 16, Link 11 etc., received from NIRIS, will be transformed and stored in NCDF format in NCDF Data Lake.
Other Test Plan could be for CoT CCs on the Green Enclave, to send data through a CDS CC to the transformation service.

name: Transform TDL Data to NCDF
description:
TIN-XXX (number will be determined by DM CaT) Transform TDL Data to NCDF.
TDL data will at first reach a transformations service (e.g. NIRIS or similar) and later be transformed into NCDF format.

name: Transform NCDF to CBRN MTF
description: Technology Interaction (TIN-347), determined and agreed by DM Cat: "Transform NCDF to CBRN MTF". This OBJ will test functionality of NCDF Transformation services (mainly INT-Core). Maturity of participating CCs - fully operational.

name: Transform NCDF to Maritime OTH-G
description: Technology Interaction (TIN-88), determined and agreed by DM Cat: "Transform NCDF to Maritime OTH-G". This OBJ will test functionality of NCDF Transformation services (mainly INT-Core). Maturity of participating CCs - fully operational.

name: Transform NCDF to Maritime MTF
description: Technology Interaction (TIN-312), determined and agreed by DM Cat: "Transform NCDF to Maritime MTF". This OBJ will test functionality of NCDF Transformation services (mainly INT-Core). Maturity of participating CCs - fully operational.

name: Transform NCDF to Air MTF
description: Technology Interaction (TIN-356), determined and agreed by DM Cat: "Transform NCDF to Air MTF". This OBJ will test functionality of NCDF Transformation services (mainly INT-Core). Maturity of participating CCs - fully operational.

name: SP6 Web Authentication
description:
Testing the SP6 SI on Web Authentication

Validating readiness for Hub and Spoke Architecture

Validating capability of Hub to broker between SAML and OIDC authentication

name: FMN SP7 SCIM
description: eXploration of SCIM for Data Directory Synchronization as replacement for LDAP

name: FMN SP7 WebRTC
description:
eXplore the use of WebRTC solutions for federated use

The current test plan establishes a provider-consumer architecture whereby each of the providers are bringing their own WebRTC server.
The consumers bring an modern day browser.

This objective explores the collaboration(audio/video + chat and screenshare) over the build in WebRTC function of modern day browsers as an day zero application.

name: SP6 SMC
description:
The primary objective is to experiment the Spiral 6 Service Instructions for Service Management and Control (SMC). This includes the verification of the labeling and binding of SMC data in accordance with ADatP 4774.7 and ADatP 4778.7 and the verification of access controls and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized clients can access REST API resources in allied mission environments.

Participating nations are expected to have implemented Data Labelling and Access capabilities as specified in TIN-437 - SMC Information Exchange Service

name: eXperimentation on DCS Level 3 (ACP 240 v2)
description: eXperimentation on DCS/ACP 240 (v2, once released), integrating 5G solutions

name: Conversion of tracks/messages between CoT and STANAG4817
description:
Exploring and experimenting the mapping/conversion of tracks between CoT and STANAG4817 (CATL), which is a NATO standard under development, targeting unmanned systems. 
The objective of this test is to evaluate the ability to effectively extend STANAG4817 capabilities to the Tactical Edge by utilizing Cursor on Target (CoT) protocols, specifically through the TAK (Tactical Assault Kit) suite. Both STANAG4817 and CoT are designed for data integration and dissemination in environments that rely on lightweight, mobile, and often disconnected nodes. At the moment, the test will focus on maintaining situational awareness about the position of the various manned/unmanned units and on achieving a combined and coherent picture among both STANAG4817-capable units and CoT-capable units. Exploring the possibility of tasking  unmanned assets from CoT-capable devices would be an interesting feature to explore for the future.
The goal is to ensure that all tactical units at the edge of the network receive timely and accurate information to support decision-making and reduce operational risks.

This activity is intended to contribute to sharing situational awareness and operational picture across multiple domain. I will also be used to '''de-risk the NATO Dynamic Messenger 2025''' exercise to be execute in September in Portugal with real unmanned systems.
The experimental part is about track conversions (position of assets) while the possible tasking (and related mapping of information) is exploratory.

Participating systems are expected to be able to effectively produce/consume tracks in CoT and/or STANAG 4817 to validate the flow of converted data into the two domains/networks and the correct mediation (mapping) of relevant fields. The tasking part is more exploratory and less stringent in terms of maturity.

name: Experiment with Service Monitoring in a FFT network
description:
Introduce concept to improve the control of the FFT systems and networks.
Evaluate the feasibility of initial tests at CWIX25

name: Transform other Native (Ops Plan, Log, Cyber, MIP, TAK) to NCDF
description: Exploit the functionalities of NCDF Transformation services to transform Native data into the NCDF format. Examples of the Native data could be MIP 5.3; CoT or Cyber BCO. Participating CCs can be semi-mature, exploring the possibilities.

name: Transformation NCDF to NVG
description: Leverage the functionalities of NCDF Transformation services to convert NCDF data into the NVG format. Supported NVG versions range from NVG 1.4 to NVG 2.0. The original (native) data, prior to transformation into NCDF, may exist in various formats, such as CoT, MTF, CBRN, or FFT. Participating CCs can be semi-mature, actively exploring potential possibilities.
